Exaggerate: The claim of Facebook removing the share button from "pro-Trump posts" is exaggerated as there is no evidence to support this claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that "pro-Trump" posts are popular and not being removed on Facebook.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or proof provided to back up the assertion.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the claim originated from a meme shared in 2017 and resurfaced in 2018 due to a contentious exchange between Mark Zuckerberg and Sen. Ted Cruz.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Facebook is intentionally removing the share button from "pro-Trump posts" without any evidence or confirmation.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating biases in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
